title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Two Massachusetts men were sentenced for mail theft and check fraud, with prison terms and restitution payments required.
Imanol Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison, while Brandon Baez was sentenced to two years for their roles.
The scheme involved stealing checks from USPS boxes and fraudulently depositing them after altering the details.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen, was invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained by ICE in May 2025 on his way to volleyball practice, resulting in community protests.
He was released on $2,000 bond after six days in detention facing 'humiliating' conditions, according to his lawyer.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win against Denmark during his first Olympic start.
Swayman attributed the goal to a momentary lapse in visibility and humorously mentioned his colorblindness affecting puck sighting.
The U.S. team has additional goaltenders Connor Hellebuyck and Jake Oettinger, raising questions on Swayman's future starts.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from his Achilles injury, missing the All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express confidence in Tatum's potential impact upon return for the Celtics' playoff push.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress in his recovery for a season comeback.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space entering the 2026 NFL offseason, allowing for key player additions.
Potential free agents for Patriots include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are considered strong free-agent targets.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN is now MLB's streaming home through its ESPN Unlimited app but MLB.TV is an added cost.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, while non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free month trial.
MLB.TV is accessible through various providers, and existing subscribers are automatically renewed with ESPN linkage options.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate, signaling potential progress in his Achilles injury recovery.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's performance in practice, noting he looked like himself.
No official timetable for Tatum's return has been provided, although he has been participating in five-on-five scrimmages.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
The state leads nationally in bachelor’s degrees with over 47% of adults holding one, and 22% with advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in education rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, dating back to 1909-1911, is up for auction, with a current bid of $3.9 million.
The card was first obtained by Morton Bernstein, a New York native connected to a Taunton, Massachusetts silver plant.
Ken Goldin, from Netflix's 'King of Collectibles,' is overseeing the auction, expected to close on February 21.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman, 27, helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship but missed last year's 4 Nations Face-Off.
Connor Hellebuyck, who started USA's Olympic opener, will back up Swayman while Jake Oettinger is the third goalie.
